pr_title: SONARJAVA-3309 Compile JSP pages to Java and provide AST to checks

timeline.bodyText: Why not be consistent with classpath and testClasspath and initialize with empty list ?
timeline.author: benzonico

timeline.bodyText: I think this comments deserve a bit of more precise wording : I thought at first that semantic won't be triggered for this file whereas it is only about feeding semantic data to SQ api.
timeline.author: benzonico

timeline.bodyText: if this method is now supposed to be called only by tests, I would annotated it by @VisibleForTests and potentially change its visibility.
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

replies.bodyText: I removed this overload, and instead added emptyList() parameter to the callers in tests.
replies.author: saberduck

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand this change, It seems to me that generatedCodeVisitors are JavaCheck, the change of method signature should not be required.
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

replies.bodyText: removed, this was leftover from some refactoring
replies.author: saberduck

timeline.bodyText: How can you be sure of that? If you transpile these files, while not using directly a predefined charset such as UTF-8?
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

replies.bodyText: ok, I found the option how to explicitly set encoding for Jasper, so we can use UTF-8 explicitly.
replies.author: saberduck

timeline.bodyText: I don't see why this type needs to be specified. it's seems unrelated to your change,
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

replies.bodyText: it's not strictly related to this PR, but I wanted to remove usage of raw type to benefit from compiler checking the correctness of types.
replies.author: saberduck

timeline.author: m-g-sonar

timeline.bodyText: c? please use a more explicit variable name. as c.all() is really not helping.
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

timeline.bodyText:
I don't see any mechanism which would prevent people writing custom rules to use this as well, expecting their code to be executed on "generated code". (code annotated with @Generated?).
While I understand that we don't necessarily want to expose everything, I would appreciate to have it a bit more explicit. note any kind of generated code is going to be analyzed by such rule.
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

+
+/**
+ * Marker interface for code visitors which are invoked on generated code
+ */
+@Beta
+public interface GeneratedCodeVisitor extends JavaCheck {

replies.bodyText: I am not sure I understand the comment, do you just want to improve javadoc?
replies.author: saberduck

timeline.bodyText: What if there is no JSP language registered? is it always the case?
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

replies.bodyText: html plugin is part of default distribution, so I believe it is safe to assume that it is available. If it's not available we will not find any files and nothing is executed.
replies.author: saberduck

timeline.author: m-g-sonar
m-g-sonar

timeline.message: SONARJAVA-3309 Transpile JSP pages to Java and parse the generated files
